content.GPT-summary: The post simply states that a proposal has been resubmitted. The author is explaining the proposal and the post can also be seen as advertising the proposal. There is no feedback or criticism given, and no collaboration or auditing is mentioned.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: This is a bit broad. Uniswap LP Tokens in general?

Agree with @Jiecut, this does seem a bit too broad. I like the thought but this would likely need to be made narrower (ie restricted to a single pool to start, eventually a short list) in order to be considered. Impermanent loss would be a major problem for less liquid and/or more volatile pairs in evaluating LP tokens as collateral. It’s not very “impermanent” at the moment of a liquidation event. Even for more liquid/less volatile pairs, modeling risk due to IL is a complex topic.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Yea. Hi @colekennelly. We require a MIP6 for each Uniswap token pair as they each need separate risk/sc parameters. You can see here and here what those look like. Thanks for participating!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal
